intro: Indurgia govindappae, commonly known as the Govindappa's indurgia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with prominent staminodes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth upper surface. Its floral structure is notable for its bilateral symmetry and the presence of nectar-rich spurs. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
